snippet: Recanting a confession the police say he gave, Conrado Juárez described the dysfunctional family in which Anjélica Castillo lived and died.
abstract: Conrado Juarez, charged in death of Anjelica Castillo, child known as Baby Hope, denies killing her but admits to helping dispose of her body; Juarez, who is a cousin of Castillo, says detectives coerced false confession; speaks at length of dysfunctional family in which child lived and died; Juarez's arrest capped 22-year search for killer of a girl no one ever reported missing.

byline.contributor: J. David Goodman, William K. Rashbaum and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Recanting a confession the police say he gave, Conrado Juárez described the dysfunctional family in which Anjélica Castillo lived and died.

headline.main: Suspect Recalls the Short Life of ‘Baby Hope’
headline.print_headline: Suspect Recalls The Short Life Of ‘Baby Hope’
